title: Great Leap Foward, government control over economy

content.question: In China between 1958 and 1962, Mao Zedongâ€™s Great Leap Forward, an effort to make China an industrial power through mass collectivization of agriculture, is best understood as an example of

choices.label: an attempt by China to win favor with policy makers in the United States
a free-market policy designed to position China as a major power in a globalizing economy
market communism in which the state increasingly cedes control to businesses run by Communist Party associates
a communist government exerting control over the national economy

content.answer: a communist government exerting control over the national economy

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Explain how a specific historical development or process is situated within a broader historical context.
